page.title: 17A RETIRED PERSON'S DAY
page.content: The object of retirement, contrary to popular belief, is not to do less work. I do much more but, because it is mainly done in my own time, I com- plete less. My day starts leisurely: over my tea in bed I plan what I hope to achieve that day - I never get through it all. Because I am retired, I get involved in many jobs: for example, the Church of which I am Treasurer, and 2 years ago I had 20 Diocesan and Deanery meetings a year. Once the jobs which must be done that day are completed and I have cleared the house chores, I am free to give the rest of the day to the Atlas I am compiling, unless interrupted by visitors. The day ends with little, or much, television and I fall asleep over the News.
